snippet: New rules for dispensing hydrocodone, the most widely prescribed painkiller in the United States, include no phoned-in prescriptions and no refills.
abstract: Drug Enforcement Administration tightens rule on hydrocodone, most widely prescribed painkiller in United States and ingredient in drugs like Vicodin, placing it in more restrictive category; move is among far-reaching efforts to stem growing epidemic of prescription drug abuse and overdose.
lead_paragraph: New rules for dispensing hydrocodone, the most widely prescribed painkiller in the United States, include no phoned-in prescriptions and no refills.

headline.main: In Move to Curb Drug Abuse, D.E.A. Tightens Rule on Widely Prescribed Painkiller
headline.print_headline: In Move to Curb Drug Abuse, D.E.A. Tightens Rule on Widely Prescribed Painkiller
